approveTokenForBridge(address,address).details: We need this to support bridges that charge fees in ERC20 tokens.

params.bridge: The bridge to approve the token for.

params._mailbox: The mailbox configured with this warp route
params._scale: A parameter used for native tokens that use different number of decimals than 1e18 (e.g: Solana Sealevel with 1e9 for 9 decimals)

params._domain: The domain of the remote Application Router
params._router: The address of the remote Application Router

params._addresses: The addresses of the remote Application Routers
params._domains: The domains of the remote Application Routers

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

quoteGasPayment(uint32).details: Assumes bytes32(0) recipient and max amount of tokens for quoting.

returns._0: payment How much native value to send in transferRemote call.

quoteTransferRemote(uint32,bytes32,uint2.details: This should be overridden for warp routes that require additional fees/approvals.

params._amount: The amount of tokens to be sent to the remote recipient.
params._recipient: The address of the recipient on the destination chain.

returns.quotes: Indicate how much of each token to approve and/or send.

rebalance(uint32,uint256,address).details: The caller must be an allowed rebalancer and the bridge must be an allowed bridge for the domain.The recipient is the enrolled router if no recipient is set for the domain.

params.amount: The amount of collateral to rebalance.
params.bridge: The bridge to use for the rebalance.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

routers(uint32).details: Returns 0 address if no router is enrolled for the given domain

returns._0: router The address of the Router contract for the given domain

params._hook: The address of the hook contract.

params._module: The address of the interchain security module contract.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

transferRemote(uint32,bytes32,uint256).details: Delegates transfer logic to `_transferFromSender` implementation.Emits `SentTransferRemote` event on the origin chain.

params._amountOrId: The amount or identifier of tokens to be sent to the remote recipient.
params._destination: The identifier of the destination chain.
params._recipient: The address of the recipient on the destination chain.

returns.messageId: The identifier of the dispatched message.

transferRemote(uint32,bytes32,uint256,by.details: Delegates transfer logic to `_transferFromSender` implementation.The metadata is the token metadata, and is DIFFERENT than the hook metadata.Emits `SentTransferRemote` event on the origin chain.

params._amountOrId: The amount or identifier of tokens to be sent to the remote recipient.
params._destination: The identifier of the destination chain.
params._hook: The post dispatch hook to be called by the Mailbox
params._hookMetadata: The metadata passed into the hook
params._recipient: The address of the recipient on the destination chain.

returns.messageId: The identifier of the dispatched message.

params._domain: The domain of the remote Application Router

params._domains: The domains of the remote Application Routers

allowedRecipient(uint32).notice: Mapping of domain to allowed rebalance recipient.

approveTokenForBridge(address,address).notice: Approves the token for the bridge.

enrollRemoteRouter(uint32,bytes32).notice: Register the address of a Router contract for the same Application on a remote chain

quoteGasPayment(uint32).notice: DEPRECATED: Use `quoteTransferRemote` instead.Returns the gas payment required to dispatch a message to the given domain's router.

quoteTransferRemote(uint32,bytes32,uint2.notice: Returns the gas payment required to dispatch a message to the given domain's router.

rebalance(uint32,uint256,address).notice: Rebalances the collateral between router domains.

routers(uint32).notice: Returns the address of the Router contract for the given domain

setDestinationGas((uint32,uint256)[]).notice: Sets the gas amount dispatched for each configured domain.

setDestinationGas(uint32,uint256).notice: Sets the gas amount dispatched for each configured domain.

setHook(address).notice: Sets the address of the application's custom hook.

setInterchainSecurityModule(address).notice: Sets the address of the application's custom interchain security module.

transferRemote(uint32,bytes32,uint256,by.notice: Transfers `_amountOrId` token to `_recipient` on `_destination` domain with a specified hook
